intro: Calamus leptospadix, commonly known as the slender-stemmed arrowroot, is a member of the Arecaceae family, native to Southeast Asia. It is a tall, slender herbaceous plant that typically grows in wet, swampy areas. The plant features long, narrow leaves that are often arched or curved, and it produces small, clustered flowers followed by spadices. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. The botanical characteristics of Calamus leptospadix make it well adapted to its wetland habitat.
